title: Beatmasters - Life & Soul@320
description:
British producer trio who enjoyed considerable success in the late 80&#039;s/early 90&#039;s. As well as producing Yazz&#039; smash hit "Stand Up For Your Love Rights" in 1988, they also landed several Top 20 hits under the Beatmasters moniker with a series of guest vocalists: The Cookie Crew ("Rok Da House"), Betty Boo ("Hey DJ / I Can&#039;t Dance (To That Music You&#039;re Playing)"), Merlin MC ("Who&#039;s in the House") and P.P. Arnold ("Burn It Up"). These hits were all featured on their debut album "Anywayawanna". After their second album "Life & Soul" (1991), The Beatmasters ditched their own recording career in favour of production work and remixes for artists such as The Shamen, Moby, Erasure, Pet Shop Boys and Marc Almond.


Members: Amanda Glanfield, Paul Carter, Richard Walmsley
